agency_desc: A national provider of wireless voice, messaging, and data services, i wireless is a partnership between T-Mobile USA and Iowa Network Services (INS). Lifeline discounted service is available through subsidiary Access Wireless.
service_description: Offers a free cell phone and 250 minutes of free, nationwide, wireless voice or texts service each month to Indiana households receiving public assistance or within set income guidelines. Minutes do not roll over from month to month. Additional minutes can be purchased. Limit one Lifeline service per household.
site_details: Call or visit website for an application.-- Customers must make at least one call per month and must reapply each year to continue service.
site_eligibility: Living in Indiana (or another state in the service area) -- Household income at or below 135% Federal Poverty Guidelines -OR- receiving Medicaid, food stamps, SSI, TANF, Section 8, EAP, or free school lunch -- No one in household already receiving Lifeline discounted service (landline or wireless)
